item.title: Calc 1: Simple Constrained Optimization
item.description: import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D import numpy as np The following are my notes on a basic Calculus 1 homework question. I liked the question a lot, so decided to write out some more extended notes on it for my future use. Question: If 2000 square centimeters of material is available to make a box with a square base and an open top, what is the largest box that you can possibly create?
